mods.abstract: First pylon and Obelisk of Rameses II, Temple of Amen at Luxor, East Thebes (New Kingdom Dynasty XIX); profile view of the first pylon of the Temple of Amen, two monumental statues of Rameses II wearing the sekhemty crown buried from the shoulders down, and the one remaining obelisk of Rameses II, indentified by cartouches, Egyptian man striding along pathway before ruins; "Frith" in black at bottom left corner; "ENTRANCE TO THE GREAT Temple. Luxor." in black under print on mat.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
